function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of semi-quantitative indices to assess resilience may lead to oversimplification of complex systems and miss important factors.","Impact":"Inadequate assessment of resilience may result in inadequate preparedness for natural disasters and lack of effective response.","Mitigation":"Use complementary qualitative and quantitative methods to supplement semi-quantitative indices, and involve multidisciplinary expertise in the assessment process.","Technologies":"Data analytics and modeling software for comprehensive resilience assessment.","People":"Communities, policymakers, and organizations at risk of natural disasters.","Owner":"Resilience experts, policymakers, and multidisciplinary teams."},{"Description":"Reliance on expert opinion for assessing resilience variables may introduce bias and inaccuracies in the assessment process.","Impact":"Biased assessments may lead to misinformed decision-making and ineffective allocation of resources for disaster preparedness and response.","Mitigation":"Combine expert opinion with data-driven approaches and validation from multiple sources to improve accuracy and reduce bias.","Technologies":"Machine learning algorithms for data validation and identification of patterns and trends.","People":"Experts, researchers, and policymakers involved in resilience assessment and decision-making.","Owner":"Data scientists, researchers, and interdisciplinary teams."}]}
